dmca.title: Notice of Infringement
dmca.body:
_____  

From: Campbell MacInnes [mailto:cmacinnes@macrovision.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, January 03, 2006 4:05 PM
To: abuse@theplanet.com; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Notice of Infringement



3 January 2006 

 

 

ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. ("The Planet")

1333 North Stemmons Freeway
Suite 110
Dallas, Texas  75207



Email:  abuse@theplanet.com and copyright@theplanet.com 

Phone:  +1-214-782-7802

Facsimile: +1-214 782-7756

 

Re:       NOTICE OF INFRINGEMENT

 

http://www.clonedvd.net/  

 

Dear Sir or Madam:

 

Macrovision is a company who provides proprietary digital rights management
technology and copy protection technology to copyright owners (e.g.,
software developers, movie studios, etc.) to electronically manage the
licensing of their products as well as to prevent the illicit copying of
their content.

 

It has come to Macrovision's attention that http://www.clonedvd.net/, a
website hosted by The Planet, is currently providing on its website products
that bypass, hack, remove or otherwise circumvent Macrovision's digital
rights management technology and copy protection technology.  These methods
and techniques are not authorized by Macrovision and are an infringement of
Macrovision's proprietary intellectual property.  Further,
http://www.clonedvd.net/ additionally infringes upon Macrovision through the
use of Macrovision's trademarks 

 

I, the undersigned, CERTIFY UNDER PENALTY OF PERJURY that I am the owner or
an agent authorized to act on behalf of the owner of certain intellectual
property rights, said owner being named Macrovision Corporation ("IP
Owner").  I have a good faith belief that the listings or materials listed
herein are not authorized by the above IP Owner, its agent, or the law and
therefore infringe the IP Owner's rights according to state, federal, or
United States law.

 

Further, Macrovision believes that these website pages directly violate The
Planet's own "Acceptable Use Policy (AUP)", specifically: 

 

Compliance with Law - Customer shall not post, transmit, re-transmit or
store material on or through any of Services or Products which, in the sole
judgment of the Company . . . (iii) violates the rights of any person,
including rights protected by copyright, trade secret, patent or other
intellectual property or similar laws or regulations including, but not
limited to, the installation or distribution of "pirated" or other software
products that are not appropriately licensed for use by Customer.

 

Copyright Infringement - Company datacenter infrastructure including
network, leased hardware, co-location services, and other hardware located
in the facility may only be used for lawful purposes. Transmission,
distribution, or storage of any information, data or material in violation
of United States or state regulation or law, or by the common law, is
prohibited. This includes, but is not limited to, material protected by
copyright, trademark, trade secret, or other intellectual property rights;
including creating, utilizing, distributing unauthorized copies of software,
or the use of BitTorrent or other types of technologies utilized in the
distribution of illegally copied materials.  If Customer copies, distributes
or installs software in defiance of the license agreement, Customer is
violating federal copyright law. Company will cooperate with all law
enforcement agencies in relation to alleged copyright infringement housed in
our datacenters.

 

Because of the economic damages that it has incurred, Macrovision must take
immediate actions to protect its interests.  As host of this website, The
Planet may also be liable if it does not take appropriate action.
Macrovision therefore demands that The Planet close or disable access to the
website until such time as it removes any products that bypass, hack, remove
or otherwise circumvent Macrovision's digital rights management technology
and copy protection technology.  If this course of actions is not executed
timely and effectively, Macrovision will have no choice but to resort to
legal recourses to protect its rights. 

 

Please be aware that Macrovision takes any infringement (misuse) of our
proprietary intellectual property most seriously and that it is our policy
to take all steps necessary to protect those rights.

 

Please act immediately and confirm to me in writing that you have done so.
If you have any questions, please contact me at cmacinnes@macrovision.com or
call me at (408) 562-8466.

 

Regards, Campbell

 

Campbell MacInnes

Macrovision Corporation

Sr. Contracts Administrator
